R94071001-d-07-10-94-TTIS.Primary Accident Cause: Use of switches, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)

R94071001-d-07-10-94-TTIS.Accident Cause: Use of switches, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)
R94071001-d-07-10-94-TTIS.Narrative: EMPLOYEE R.L. TAYLOR LINED THE SOUTH LADDER TRACK FOR HIS INTENDED MOVEMENT. HE MADE 3 DOUBLE OVERSON THE NORTH END AND THEN DIRECTED HIS ENGINEER TO SHOVE BACK HIS 62 CAR TRAIN IN THE CLEAR ON THE NORTH END. HE DIRECTED THIS MOVEMENT FROM THE HEAD END, THINKING THAT HIS ALIGNMENT ON THE SOUTH ENDWAS STILL CORRECT. DISPATCHER R.V. DOWLER GAVE A CSX CREW PERMISSION TO PULL EMPTY CARS OUT OF THE #4 TRACK FROM THE SOUTH END, WITHIN THIS SAME TIME FRAME, AND HE DID NOT ADVISE R.L. TAYLOR OF THIS SINCE THEY CAME IN FROM THE SOUTH END, COMPLETED THEIR WORK, AND REPORTED CLEAR OF THE YARD, WHILE R.L. TAYLOR WAS STILL MAKING UP HIS TRAIN AND WAS NOT READY TO SHOVE BACK. THE #4 TRACK SWITCH WAS LEFT IMPROPERLY LINED FOR R.L. TAYLOR'S MOVEMENT AND THE SWITCH WAS RUN THROUGH. ABOUT ONE AND ONE-HALFHOURS LATER, WHEN ANOTHER TRAIN CREW PROCEEDED NORTH WITH THE TRAIN, THE SPLIT SWITCH CAUSED THIS DERAILMENT TO OCCUR.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
